unload.stay.developer_comment: Part of confirmation prompt that appears when closing with unsaved changes in desktop app

unload.leave.developer_comment: Part of confirmation prompt that appears when closing with unsaved changes in desktop app

unload.message.string: Are you sure you want to quit?
unload.message.developer_comment: Part of confirmation prompt that appears when closing with unsaved changes in desktop app

unload.detail.string: Any unsaved changes will be lost.
unload.detail.developer_comment: Part of confirmation prompt that appears when closing with unsaved changes in desktop app

menu.about.developer_comment: macOS menu bar item to open about window

menu.new-window.developer_comment: macOS menu bar item to open a new editor window

menu.close-window.developer_comment: macOS menu bar item to close the current window

menu.settings.developer_comment: macOS menu bar item to open desktop settings window

menu.addons.developer_comment: macOS menu bar item to open addon settings window

menu.package.developer_comment: macOS menu bar item to package the project opened in the editor

menu.reload.developer_comment: macOS menu bar item to reload window, like a browser

menu.learn-more.developer_comment: macOS menu bar item to learn more

context.add-to-dictionary.developer_comment: Context menu item that appears when right clicking on a misspelled word

context.open-link.developer_comment: Context menu item to open link

permission.audio-denied.developer_comment: Appears when someone doesn't give the app access to their microphone.

permission.audio-denied-description.string: The app will not be able to record sounds or detect loudness.
permission.audio-denied-description.developer_comment: Appears when someone doesn't give the app access to their microphone.

permission.video-denied.developer_comment: Appears when someone doesn't give the app access to their camera.

permission.video-denied-description.string: The app will not be able to take photos or use video sensing.
permission.video-denied-description.developer_comment: Appears when someone doesn't give the app access to their camera.

permission.macos-instructions.string: To change permissions, open System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy > Camera or Microphone.
permission.macos-instructions.developer_comment: Appears on macOS when someone doesn't give the app access to their camera or microphone

prompt.ok.developer_comment: Appears in alert boxes, confirmation messages, and text prompts

prompt.cancel.developer_comment: Appears in confirmation messages and text prompts

packager.loading-preview.developer_comment: Loading message for packager preview windows

arm-translation.title.string: Please download the ARM version instead
arm-translation.title.developer_comment: Appears when running the app in an ARM translator such as Apple's Rosetta

arm-translation.message.string: You're using {APP_NAME} in a translation layer such as Apple Rosetta. Please install the native ARM version instead as it will perform better and use less battery.
arm-translation.message.developer_comment: Appears when running the app in an ARM translator such as Apple's Rosetta

arm-translation.ok.developer_comment: Appears when running the app in an ARM translator such as Apple's Rosetta. This button will open a browser to install the correct version.

arm-translation.ignore.developer_comment: Appears when running the app in an ARM translator such as Apple's Rosetta. This button will ignore the warning and continue anyways.

unnecessary-legacy.title.string: Please don't use the legacy version
unnecessary-legacy.title.developer_comment: Appears when running the legacy version of the app on a device that does not need to

unnecessary-legacy.message.string: You are using the 'Legacy' version of {APP_NAME} on a device that doesn't need to. This is insecure, slower, and may PERMANENTLY delete your settings and backpack. Please install the normal version instead.
unnecessary-legacy.message.developer_comment: Appears when running the legacy version of the app on a device that does not need to

unnecessary-legacy.ok.developer_comment: Appears when running the legacy version of the app on a device that does not need to. This button will open a browser to install the correct version.

unnecessary-legacy.ignore.developer_comment: Appears when running the legacy version of the app on a device that does not need to. This button will ignore the warning and continue anyways.

in-app-about.desktop-settings.developer_comment: Part of the in-app (?) button's menu. Opens desktop settings window.

in-app-about.privacy.developer_comment: Part of the in-app (?) button's menu. Opens privacy policy window.

in-app-about.about.developer_comment: Part of the in-app (?) button's menu. Opens about window.

in-app-about.source-code.developer_comment: Part of the in-app (?) button's menu. Opens link to source code.

in-app-about.donate.developer_comment: Part of the in-app (?) button's menu. Opens link to donation page.

desktop-settings.update-checker-not-allo.string: Updates are managed by the store you installed the app from.
desktop-settings.update-checker-not-allo.developer_comment: Appears in desktop settings when updates are handled by the store the app was installed from such as the Microsoft Store.

desktop-settings.update-checker.developer_comment: Label of dropdown to configure the update checker

desktop-settings.disabled-updates.string: Disabling the update checker is not recommended as you will not be notified about security updates.
desktop-settings.disabled-updates.developer_comment: Warning that appears in desktop settings when the update checker is disabled

desktop-settings.microphone.developer_comment: Label of dropdown to select active microphone

desktop-settings.camera.developer_comment: Label of dropdown to select active camera

desktop-settings.loading.developer_comment: Placeholder item in dropdown while data is being fetched

desktop-settings.no-devices.developer_comment: Appears in dropdown to select camera or microphone if none were found

desktop-settings.error.developer_comment: Appears in dropdown to select camera or microphone if there was an error

desktop-settings.editor-must-be-open.string: Error: Open editor to configure devices
desktop-settings.editor-must-be-open.developer_comment: Appears in dropdown to select camera or microphone if the editor is not open

desktop-settings.media-devices-changed.string: You may have to restart the application for microphone or camera changes to apply.
desktop-settings.media-devices-changed.developer_comment: Warning that appears in desktop settings after changing the selected camera or microphone

desktop-settings.hardware-acceleration.developer_comment: Desktop settings option to toggle hardware acceleration

desktop-settings.hardware-acceleration-d.string: Disabling hardware acceleration is not recommended as hardware acceleration almost always improves performance.
desktop-settings.hardware-acceleration-d.developer_comment: Warning that appears in desktop settings when hardware acceleration is disabled

desktop-settings.background-throttling.developer_comment: Desktop settings option to disable background window throttling

desktop-settings.background-throttling-d.string: Allowing hidden windows to remain active will result in higher CPU usage and lower battery life.
desktop-settings.background-throttling-d.developer_comment: Warning that appears in desktop settings when background throttling is disabled

desktop-settings.bypass-cors.string: Allow extensions to access any website
desktop-settings.bypass-cors.developer_comment: Desktop settings option to let extensions bypass normal security stuff

desktop-settings.bypass-cors-enabled.string: This disables several web security features designed to protect you. Malicious projects or extensions will be able to access any website or device on your network.
desktop-settings.bypass-cors-enabled.developer_comment: Warning that appears in desktop settings when bypass CORS is enabled

desktop-settings.spellchecker.developer_comment: Option in desktop settings to disable spell checking

desktop-settings.exit-fullscreen-on-esca.string: Exit F11 fullscreen mode (not the fullscreen button in the editor) when pressing escape
desktop-settings.exit-fullscreen-on-esca.developer_comment: Refering to when an entire window is in fullscreen by pressing F11 or the maximize button on macOS, not the fullscreen mode you get by pressing the fullscreen button in the editor.

desktop-settings.rich-presence.developer_comment: Option to enable Discord Rich Presence support, which shows the name of the project someone is editing on their Discord profile. For compliance with Scratch policies don't use the word "Discord" in the translation.

desktop-settings.rich-presence-unavailab.string: Rich Presence is not available in this version of the app
desktop-settings.rich-presence-unavailab.developer_comment: Appears in desktop settings after a disabled checkbox (grayed out and unchangeable) if Discord Rich Presence can't be enabled.

desktop-settings.more-information.developer_comment: Appears in desktop settings after options as a link to a webpage with more information about the option.

desktop-settings.open-user-data.developer_comment: Button in desktop settings to open the user data folder

migrate.title.developer_comment: Title of window that does various things to finish an update

migrate.description.string: This is a one-time process that may take a few moments.
migrate.description.developer_comment: More information about process to finish an update

migrate.error.string: There was an error finishing this update. Some data may not have transferred correctly. Send a screenshot of this window to:
migrate.error.developer_comment: Appears when there was an error finishing an update. Followed by an email.

migrate.timed-out.string: This process is taking an unusually long time. If no progress is being made, please send a screenshot of this window to:
migrate.timed-out.developer_comment: Appears when finishing an update is taking longer than it usually does. There are some other pieces of text on the screen that may indicate progress is still being made, albiet slowly. Followed by an email.

migrate.renderer-gone.string: Updating process crashed (reason: {reason}, code: {code}). Some data may not have transferred correctly. Please send a screenshot of this window to:
migrate.renderer-gone.developer_comment: Appears when an important process crashes while finishing an update.

migrate.continue-anyways.developer_comment: Appears when there was an error finishing an update. This button ignores the error and continues anyways.

migrate.continue-anyways-afterword.string: If any of your data is missing, please contact us at {email}.
migrate.continue-anyways-afterword.developer_comment: Appears after there was an error finishing an update and someone clicks the Continue Anyways button to ignore the error.

migrate.exit.developer_comment: Appears when there was an error finishing an update. This button closes the app and does not continue.

migrate.preparing.developer_comment: Status message that appears while finishing an update.

migrate.transfer-editor.developer_comment: Status message that appears while finishing an update.

migrate.transfer-packager.developer_comment: Status message that appears while finishing an update.

migrate.finalizing.developer_comment: Status message that appears while finishing an update.

migrate.delete-legacy.developer_comment: Status message that appears while finishing an update. Old data refers to data stored by old versions of the app that is now redundant after updates.

downgrade-warning.title.developer_comment: Appears when someone installs the latest version of the dekstop app, runs it, then installs and runs an older version.

downgrade-warning.message.string:
You are using an older version of {APP_NAME} after using a later version. Please exit and download the latest version from {website}.

If you continue, it is VERY LIKELY that you will PERMANENTLY lose all of your settings and backpack. We WILL NOT be able to recover your data.

(Debug info: {debugInfo})
downgrade-warning.message.developer_comment: Appears when someone installs the latest version of the dekstop app, runs it, then installs and runs an older version. {APP_NAME} becomes 'TurboWarp Desktop'. {website} becomes a URL like 'desktop.turbowarp.org'. {debugInfo} becomes some internal stuff that shouldn't matter. This is supposed to be a very scary warning.

downgrade-warning.exit.developer_comment: Appears when someone installs the latest version of the dekstop app, runs it, then installs and runs an older version. This button exits the app and opens the website for someone to download the latest version.

downgrade-warning.continue-anyways.developer_comment: Appears when someone installs the latest version of the dekstop app, runs it, then installs and runs an older version. This button ignores the warning and will just continue anyways, possibly deleting user data, and thus is very dangerous.

update.normal-title.developer_comment: Header of update available window for normal update

update.security-title.developer_comment: Header of update available window for security updates

update.normal-description.developer_comment: Description of update available window for normal update. {appNameVersion} will be replaced with something like 'TurboWarp Desktop v1.2.3'.

update.security-description.string: {appNameVersion} is now available. This release contains security fixes. Updating is highly recommended.
update.security-description.developer_comment: Description of update available window for security update. {appNameVersion} will be replaced with something like 'TurboWarp Desktop v1.2.3'.

update.loading.developer_comment: Appears in update available window while the changelog is still loading

update.download-button.developer_comment: Appears in update available window. Button to download the update.

update.ignore-button.developer_comment: Appears in update available window. Button to ignore this update temporarily.

update.permanently-ignore.developer_comment: Appears in update available window. Checkbox to ignore this update permanently.

update.not-available.developer_comment: Appears in update available window when, for some reason, no detailed release notes are available.

update.changelog-error.developer_comment: Appears in update available window when changelog could not be loaded, for example because the website is down.

files.svg.developer_comment: Appears in file saving dialog when exporting a vector costume

files.png.developer_comment: Appears in file saving dialog when exporting a bitmap costume

files.wav.developer_comment: Appears in file saving dialog when exporting a sound

files.sprite3.developer_comment: Appears in file saving dialog when exporting a sprite

files.txt.developer_comment: Appears in file saving dialog when exporting a list

files.webm.developer_comment: Appears in file saving dialog when exporting a video with an addon

files.html.developer_comment: Appears in file saving dialog when saving some types of packaged projects

files.zip.developer_comment: Appears in file saving dialog when saving some types of packaged projects

security-prompt.title.developer_comment: Title of extension security prompt window

security-prompt.allow.developer_comment: Title of extension security prompt window. This button allows the permission.

security-prompt.deny.developer_comment: Title of extension security prompt window. This button denies the permission.

security-prompt.read-clipboard1.string: The project wants to read data from your clipboard.
security-prompt.read-clipboard1.developer_comment: Part of the extension security prompt window

security-prompt.read-clipboard2.string: If your clipboard contains things like passwords, the project may be able to share those with other users or servers.
security-prompt.read-clipboard2.developer_comment: Part of the extension security prompt window

security-prompt.read-clipboard3.string: Clipboard access may not work on some systems. If allowed, further clipboard reads will be automatically allowed.
security-prompt.read-clipboard3.developer_comment: Part of the extension security prompt window

security-prompt.notifications1.string: The project wants to display notifications.
security-prompt.notifications1.developer_comment: Part of the extension security prompt window

security-prompt.notifications2.string: If allowed, you may be prompted to enable notifications by your operating system, and further notifications will be automatically allowed.
security-prompt.notifications2.developer_comment: Part of the extension security prompt window

unsafe-path.title.developer_comment: Title of alert that appears when someone tries to save project in an 'unsafe' place where their work would end up being deleted.

unsafe-path.details.string: The file you selected ({file}) is in a folder used internally by {APP_NAME}. It is not safe to save projects here as they can be deleted when the app updates. You must choose a different folder.
unsafe-path.details.developer_comment: Message of alert that appears when someone tries to save project in a folder used internally by the app. {file} is replaced with the path and {APP_NAME} with the name of the app.

rich-presence.untitled.developer_comment: Appears in Discord rich presence when the current project doesn't have a name.

file-access.window-title.developer_comment: Title of window that appears when user tries to drag & drop a file that the app can't access because of a security sandbox.

file-access.flatpak.string: The Flatpak sandbox may be preventing {APP_NAME} from accessing files that you tried to drag and drop:
file-access.flatpak.developer_comment: Part of window that appears when user tries to drag & drop a file that the app can't access. Followed by list of paths. Leave 'Flatpak' in English.

file-access.how-to-fix.string: Use the file pickers in the app instead of drag and drop, or run the following command in a terminal and restart the app to grant access:
file-access.how-to-fix.developer_comment: Part of window that appears when user tries to drag & drop a file that the app can't access. Followed by a terminal command.

data-preview.title.developer_comment: Title of windows when a project opens a data: URL. data: is a technical term, you probably don't need to translate it.

extension-documentation.title.developer_comment: Title of in-app window for viewing extension documentation.

unresponsive.message.string: This window is unresponsive. It will continue to run in the background.
unresponsive.message.developer_comment: Alert that appears when a window stops responding (stuck in infinite loop)

unresponsive.checkbox.developer_comment: Option in unresponsive window alert to ignore additional alerts.
